review_title: Tutoring as a Work-study Student at KCAI
pros: The Art History department is unparallelled in its demands for the highest quality of writing each student can achieve, and it shows in the work people do with the tutors.  Tutoring is a great way for a student who has talent in writing to become better at their own work, while helping and getting to know the other students.  Management is comprehensive and supportive.  Pay is low, due to administrative rules regarding work-study allowances.  The Art Institute pays bi-monthly, so one must plan accordingly.  -Truly a job worth doing while one is in school.
cons: There is not a great deal of training.  I had been trained at seminars at the school where I previously attended and tutored, and found some of the other student tutors lacking in finesse.  Overall, they jumped in with me and we tidied up our methods, providing excellent help to our peers.  The hiring of a new tutoring assistant who will be present, full-time, will eventually bring training and improvement to the work done in this department.
